proof:
Proof. Consider arbitrary $F \in B_1$. As we saw in Case 0 of the proof of Lemma 53, the number of singleton components in $(V_c, F)$ is at most $(1 - \frac{2\eta}{3})n$. Let $S$ be the set of vertices that are in components of size $\ge 2$.
Note that the edges of $F$ have all endpoints in $S$, thus $|F| \le e_G(S)$. Combining Lemmas 29, 30 (with $R$ being the $k$ from the previous lemma) and 35, we get for all $d$ large enough, whp, for any connected subset $S' \subseteq S$ of $(V_c, F)$, $e_G(S') \le |S'|(1+\max(1, d\eta/3))$. Hence, $e_G(S) \le |S|(2+d\eta/3)$. Since $e_G(S) \ge |F| \ge \frac{9\eta}{10}|E_c|$, we must have $|S| \ge \frac{9\eta|E_c|}{10d(\eta/3+2/d)}$. Since each component containing vertices from $S$ has at least 2 vertices, the number of components is reduced relative to the number of vertices. The number of components within $S$ is at most $|S|/2$, while the number of singletons is $n-|S|$. Thus, we can bound the total number of components by $c(F) \le n+|S|/2$. Therefore we can bound
$$
\frac{w_G(F)}{w_G(\emptyset)} = q^{c(F)-n_c}(e^\beta-1)^{|F|} \le q^{n+\frac{|S|}{2}-n_c}(e^\beta-1)^{|F|} \le q^{n+\frac{9\eta|E_c|}{20d(\eta/3+2/d)}-n_c}(e^\beta-1)^{|F|} \le q^{\frac{9\eta|E_c|}{10d}(\frac{1}{2(\eta/3+2/d)}+21)}
$$
where the last inequality follows from $\beta \le \beta_1$ and that whp $n_c \ge n(1-e^{-d/3})$. For all $d$ large enough $\frac{9}{2(\eta/3+2/d)}+21 > 1$. By Lemma 39, whp $|E_c| \ge \frac{dn}{2}-2ne^{-d/3} \ge \frac{dn}{3}$, giving that $\frac{w_G(F)}{Z_c^{\mathrm{dis}}} \le q^{n[\eta/20+e^{-d/3}]}$. For all $d$ large enough, this is at most $q^{n\eta/15}$. Aggregating over at most $2^{|E_c|} \le 2^{dn}$ configurations $F$, we get that $\pi_c^{\mathrm{dis}}(B_1) \le e^{-\Omega(n)}$ for all $q$ large enough.
